ai-tha-ap331:0.3_0: he gave the Elder Nun Bhaddiya the Dwarf
ai-tha-ap331:1.1_0: “There is no need for the Fortunate One,
ai-tha-ap331:2.2_0: you’re delightful and pleasing to yourself.
ai-tha-ap331:3.3_0: the Teacher, while standing in the Saṅgha,
ai-tha-ap331:4.1_0: ʻThose who my mind have confidence in me,
ai-tha-ap331:4.4_0: he doesn’t go to a bad place.’
ai-tha-ap331:5.1_0: After saying this, the Sambuddha, the Awakened One,
ai-tha-ap331:5.4_0: I’m not stuck in the air.
ai-tha-ap331:6.1_0: When the rain has fallen down,
ai-tha-ap331:6.2_0: The peaceful one, who stands on the ground,
ai-tha-ap331:6.4_0: if he is going to the supreme blessing;
ai-tha-ap331:7.1_0: if he makes his four eons;
ai-tha-ap331:7.3_0: I’m not aware of any living creatures.
ai-tha-ap331:8.1_0: In the four ways of attending to perception,
ai-tha-ap331:10.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Universal Monarch.
ai-tha-ap331:11.1_0: the ninth Elder Nun Bodhi tree fell nine,
